column1: Urine Leakage When there is a Strong Desire to Void

column2: sailpartner, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: After 16 days on Toviaz, I am looking forward to this drug exiting my body. I am in my fourth hour of having a strong urge to urinate and standing in front of the toilet and getting no flow. This is a horrible feeling and it has kept me awake since 2 am.  I hoped I could tough it out and the situation would improve, but no luck.  Before this drug I never experienced the problem of inability to commence flow.  The dry mouth during sleep seems solvable and I could handle that.  Can you imagine having to run to the toilet with a huge urge to pee, and then we you arrive and give your body the command to open the floodgates, and nothing happens!! The feeling continues and continues and will not stop.  Such is my current state.  I wish I could hurry up  the process of getting this drug out of my body permanently so I could pee.  I admire the concept of experimentation and Toviaz is that, for me I wish I could give it a rating of one half a star.    By the way, I am so thankful to this website to have a forum to read others  experience with this drug. It is very helpful to not feel alone in this experiment.

column2: Paula A, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have been on this medicine for approx. 3 months.  At first I was on Detrol which was not effective.  Toviaz started out effective however that is no longer the case.  Also, the dry mouth keeps me sipping water all day and my dentist has prescribed me a special tooth paste to combat this.  I go to the bathroom during the day every two hours as directed by my doctor, and still when I get up after laying down, I leak.  Would like to go to bed without wearing pull up pads.  I will soon change meds again.  Also, my scalp itches and the dandruff is awful!  Never had it before the toviaz.

column2: Trisha0309, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been on Toviaz 8mg for 5 days & cannot believe the difference.  My problem is extreme sudden urge where I frequently did not make it to the bathroom. I tried Vesicare & something else but nothing worked for me.  Toviaz is definitely it.  I do have dry mouth & occasion constipation but have always been constipated so not worried about that part.  I'll deal with it. The dry mouth is not so bad that I can't handle it.  I am very very happy with the results of Toviaz.  I have gone from changing a maxi pad twice daily to now lasting all day with not one dribble.  I only get up once a night to make a potty run, so that is not bad at all.  When I started taking Toviaz, the effects were immediate although the dr told me it would take 7 days to reach full effectiveness.  This is definitely the drug for me.  Yes it is very expensive but it sure beats being miserable and not feeling clean all day.  Even with my insurance it's $200 for a 3 month supply.  I don't care.  if I have dealt with my problem for years and now I feel I am free!  Thanks Toviaz, you have given me my life back.  Yes I know I sound like a commercial, but I'm just so happy I have found a solution to my problem I wanted to share it with the world!

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient)
column9: I starting having bladder pains starting August of 2010 after infections were ruled out I began seeing a Urologist and  had  procedure done that determined I had overactive bladder. He stated me on 4 mg Toviaz right away and told me it takes up to 12 weeks to really start noticing a difference. After about 2 months the pain was for the most part gone and I was back to a normal amount of voiding. I have been on it since around October 2010 and I can drink alcohol and eat whatever I want because the medicine works very well. If my drinking is way out of hand however I do feel achy the next day but that is at no surprise. Sex is better I don't feel like I am bruised or have to pee anymore. For the first 2 weeks I had blurred vision, headaches, and dry mouth but these symptoms virtually disappeared after around 2 or 3 weeks. I would give this medicine a shot, it take around 3 months to start working so don't stop taking it after one month if you are not feeling better it takes a long time and is VERY EFFECTIVE. One little thing is I think I have gained a small amount of weight in my stomach but this could just be normal weight gain and its not much I weigh 126lbs...and before taking weighed maybe 123..so no big deal...worth a shot for sure

column2: Mama Llama, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: Toviaz, in addition to doing Kegels and watching acid foods and drinks,  has helped reduce bathroom trips, stopped most of my leaking, have more control starting and stopping the flow and can hold off going to the bathroom longer.  I only go once thru the night now. I have gone from using several panty liners thru the day to just one if I leave the house, just in case.  I have asthma, so if I have a full bladder and need to cough and haven't gone to the bathroom, there's a good chance I'll leak.  I do have a very dry mouth, but just chew gum, suck on hard candy or drink more water.  My eyes are also dry, but just use drops as needed.  Leaving the house is now a pleasure - car trips are great.  I still want to know where all the bathrooms are....just in case!! Go to the Toviaz website to learn as much as possible to help your condition.  It has really paid off for me!  Oh, most importantly, my doctor REALLY works with me!!

column9: This is the second drug I've taken for overactive bladder.  The first one was Santura, which was awful.  This is better, but I'm not totally cured.  Some days are better than others. I've been taking it now for 3 months. It works, but it could be better.

column2: Slade, 65-74 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Following prostate reduction surgery I was in deep trouble.....frequent, SUDDEN urges that allowed no more than 15 seconds till start!!!!!! First two medications produced zero relief. Topiaz 8mg has produced 95% relief and no more 'accidents'.

column2: 75 or over Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: i don't have to run to the bathroom like before.i can now hold it a little longer.the dry mouth i get is what i don't like

column2: bradys888, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been plagued with urinary frequency since 2002 when I had cystocele/rectocele surgery.  I have tried several other kinds of meds with no relief. I took my first Toviaz pill at 6 this evening and it is now 2 AM and I can't sleep because I have a constant urge to urinate--but CAN'T. I am spending all my sleep time in the bathroom feeling like I urgently have to go and absolutely nothing comes out.  Painful abdomenal contractions with no result.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)

It is extrememely expensive and with my insurance, I still have to pay $67.00 per monthly dosage.  I like it but I can't afford this medication.

column1: Urine Leakage When there is a Strong Desire to Void
column2: Len, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: My history of incontinence includes treatment with multiple meds, TVT insertion and removal because it kinked, and recently collagen injection. I was diagnosed with problems in both my bladder and urethra. I continued to have problems of constant spasms (didn't realize they were constant until I took Toviaz and didn't have any at all until it was really time). It's like the switch was turned off. No urgency and leaking only occurring if I have really waited too long - like 6 hours during the day. It's early so I know it may not stay this way, but I am hopeful. The only side effect I've had is dry mouth.

column2: g-maw, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I have been on this medicine for  5 days . I have experienced , sleeplisness, stomach cramps, very bad disiness, i have enjured my self, i have a bad bump on the back of my head! I have had no relief. This medicine did not work for me.

column2: citrinelily, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: one of the better bladder meds i've tried in awhile. the blurred vision and diffuculty sleeping (both very annoying) go away after awhile. the only thing that kinda worries me is, has anyone else lost their sense of taste since they've started taking it? trying to figure out if it's the med or something else i'm doing. otherwise it works pretty well for me. it's nice not having to pee every 5 minutes or know where every bathroom is. i only have to get up once in the middle of the night now instead of 2 or 3 times. so all in all i'd say it's a relative success.

column1: Urine Leakage When there is a Strong Desire to Void

column9: I have tried everything over the past 10 years and Toviaz is the only thing that has worked effectively.  I even cut down from the 8 to the 4 mg.  The side effects are constipation but I just drink more water and eat more fruit.  It is worth it.

column2: Socks719, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I am a 37 yr old female who has trouble with bladder leakage (SIU) when running, jumping (or any 'active' excercise), and during sex (yeah, major one there), sneezing coughing, walking stairs, etc.  I was prescribed this and have been taking for 3+ months.  I am no longerleaking when I cough or sneeze and I can walk to stairs without leaking.  But if I run or do any kind of exercise or activity that  causes me to bounce or a jolting motion, then I not only leak, the flood gates just open and at this point I am so frustrated.  Thinking about surgery as I'm tired of medicine not taking care of the "whole" problem.  Any recommendations?  I use the restroom before I leave my house and then before I begin exercising and it doesn't help.  I'd love to go on a roller coaster with my kid this summer, but that too causes a full bladder loss, even on Toviaz.  Help . . .

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: I have had success with this medication for overactive bladder.  8mg too strong and unable to urinate.  4mg seems to work for me.  I have had dry mouth and have gained weight since taking this medication.  Does anyone else have same effects.

column2: ellenkcmo, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: This is 99% better than Detrol,enablex,vesicare.for me. column2: heavenscuz, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: From my experience, Toviaz is one of the biggest jokes in medicines. Instead of helping the problem, it made it worse. I had more frequent trips and it was like someone opened the flood gates. Instead of being able to hold my urine, I would start urinating before I could even get up. It was more urgent than before I started the medicine. Along with this problem, I had constant nausea, no appetite, bouts of depression and swelling in the neck area. I would not recommend this to my worst enemy.
